drive.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to make a car, truck, bus etc move along
drive.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: So when did you learn to drive?
I am planning to drive to Morocco next year.
drive.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: if a car, truck etc drives somewhere, it moves there
drive.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: After the accident, the other car just drove off.
drive.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: if people drive somewhere, they travel somewhere in a car
drive.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Shall we drive or take the bus?
drive.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: to take someone somewhere in a car, truck etc
drive.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: to force a person or animal to go somewhere
drive.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: Torrential rain drove the players off the course.
With a few loud whistles, they drove the donkeys out of the enclosure.
drive.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: to strongly influence someone to do something
drive.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: Phil, driven by jealousy, started spying on his wife.
The detective wondered what had driven Christine to phone her.
The noises in my head have nearly driven me to suicide.
drive.translation[0].definitions[6].sign: make somebody/something be in a bad state
drive.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: to make someone or something get into a bad or extreme state, usually an emotional one
drive.translation[0].definitions[6].note: drive somebody up the wall/out of their mind (=make someone feel very annoyed)
drive.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: This cough is driving me mad!
The mosquitoes drive me to distraction.
The factory had been driven into bankruptcy.
drive.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: to hit or push something into something else
drive.translation[0].definitions[7].exam: We watched Dad drive the posts into the ground.
She drove her heels into the sand.
drive.translation[0].definitions[8].defi: to make a person or animal work hard
drive.translation[0].definitions[9].defi: to move a ball etc forward in a game of baseball, football, golf etc by hitting or kicking it hard and fast
drive.translation[0].definitions[9].exam: He drove the ball into the corner of the net.
drive.translation[0].definitions[10].def: to run with the ball towards the goal in sports such as basketball and American football
drive.translation[0].definitions[11].def: to provide the power for a vehicle or machine
drive.translation[0].definitions[12].def: if rain, snow, wind etc drives somewhere, it moves very quickly in that direction
drive.translation[0].definitions[12].exa: The rain was driving down hard.
drive.translation[0].definitions[13].def: to make a large hole in something using heavy equipment or machinery
drive.translation[0].definitions[13].exa: They drove a tunnel through the mountains.
drive.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 4: to make someone or something get into a bad or extreme state, usually an emotional one
drive.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The continuous noise was driving me crazy.
drive somebody up the wall/round the bend/out of their mind
That voice of hers drives me up the wall.
She was being driven to distraction by her husband’s bad habits.
Escalating personal debts have driven many people to despair.
His problems had almost driven him to drink.
drive.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: It’s a two-hour drive from Calais to Thiepval.
Let’s go for a drive along the coast.
Taylor took me for a drive through the town.
drive.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a strong natural need or desire
drive.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The treatment will not affect your sex drive.
drive.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: the hard area or road between your house and the street
drive.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: He parked his car in the drive.
drive.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: an effort to achieve something, especially an effort by an organization for a particular purpose
drive.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: a recruitment drive for new members
an economy drive (=effort to reduce spending)
a nationwide drive to crack down on crime
drive.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: the power from an engine that makes the wheels of a vehicle go round
drive.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: a piece of equipment in a computer that is used to get information from a disk or to store information on it
drive.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: an act of hitting a ball hard, especially in tennis, baseball, or golf
drive.translation[1].definitions[7].exam: He hit a long, high drive to right field.
drive.translation[1].definitions[8].exam: a drive deep into enemy territory
drive.translation[1].definitions[9].defi: when animals such as cows or sheep are brought together and made to move in a particular direction
drive.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: used in the names of roads
drive.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: to succeed by arguing in a very determined way in making an agreement that is very much to your advantage
drive.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: Sorrell drives a hard bargain and may not sell at all if he can’t get a suitable price.
drive.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: a planned effort by an organization to achieve something
drive.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: They have decided to sell some parts of the business in a drive to raise capital.
The airlines will step up their recruitment drive for pilots in North America.
drive.translation[4].definitions[1].defi: a part of a computer that reads information from a disk
drive.translation[4].definitions[1].exam: Insert the floppy disk into Drive A.
